title: The New York Times Smart Sunday Crosswords Volume 3: 50 Sunday Puzzles from the Pages of The New York Times
features: The first, and still the best!The
Sunday crossword debuted in 1942, and ever since has remained the nation's favorite puzzle. With giant-size grids, inventive themes and clever construction, the Sunday
crossword is more popular than ever before under legendary editor Will Shortz!This thirty-fourth collection of the Sunday puzzles features:* Fifty
Sunday crosswords edited by Will Shortz* Puzzles over 50% bigger than the weekday crosswords* Covered spiral binding for easy stay-flat solving.
description: “[Will Shortz] is the crossword king.” ―Steve Kroft, 60 Minutes“The prince of crossword puzzlers.” ―
“The Riddler's got nothing on Will Shortz.” ―
“Will Shortz is [the crossword book world's] John Grisham.” ―Martin Arnold

is a daily newspaper published in New York City and distributed internationally. Founded in 1851, the newspaper has won 112 Pulitzer Prizes, more than any other news organization. Its website receives 30 million unique visitors per month.
has been the crossword puzzle editor of

since 1993. He is also the puzzlemaster on NPR’s Weekend Edition Sunday and is founder and director of the annual American Crossword Puzzle Tournament. He has edited countless books of crossword puzzles, Sudoku, KenKen, and all manner of brain-busters.
